vulnerability.message:
Package: coreutils
Installed Version: 9.4-3ubuntu6
Vulnerability CVE-2016-2781
Severity: LOW
Fixed Version: 
Link: [CVE-2016-2781](https://avd.aquasec.com/nvd/cve-2016-2781)
vulnerability.short_description: coreutils: Non-privileged session can escape to the parent session in chroot
vulnerability.full_description: chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

analysis.raw_analysis: The vulnerability is present in the coreutils package. This package is a core part of the Linux operating system, and as such, it is present in every distribution. This package provides a number of utilities, including the ability to compress and decompress files, edit text files, and manipulate strings. The vulnerability is present in the trivy utility, which is used to detect vulnerabilities in software packages. This vulnerability is present in the version of trivy that is installed with Ubuntu 16.04, and is not present in the version of trivy that is installed with Ubuntu 16.10, 17.04, or 17.10. This vulnerability is not present in the version of trivy that is installed with Ubuntu 18.04

structured_analysis.remediation: Review and apply security best practices
structured_analysis.prevention: Implement security monitoring and regular updates

vulnerability.message:
Package: curl
Installed Version: 8.5.0-2ubuntu10.6
Vulnerability CVE-2025-0167
Severity: LOW
Fixed Version: 
Link: [CVE-2025-0167](https://avd.aquasec.com/nvd/cve-2025-0167)
vulnerability.short_description: When asked to use a `.netrc` file for credentials **and** to follow HT ...
vulnerability.full_description:
When asked to use a `.netrc` file for credentials **and** to follow HTTP
redirects, curl could leak the password used for the first host to the
followed-to host under certain circumstances.

This flaw only manifests itself if the netrc file has a `default` entry that
omits both login and password. A rare circumstance.

analysis.raw_analysis: CVE-2025-0167 is a vulnerability in the `curl` package. This vulnerability is a remote code execution vulnerability in the `curl` package. analysis.raw_analysis:
CVE-2025-0167 is a vulnerability in the curl library. It allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system, which can be used to elevate privileges and gain access to the system. This vulnerability is present in the curl library, which is used by many applications, including web browsers, file managers, and other utilities. 
Remediation: 
The vulnerability can be mitigated by upgrading to the latest version of the curl library, which is available in Ubuntu 20.04 and later. The latest version of the curl library can be found at: https://curl.org/download.html
Impact: 
The vulnerability can be used to elevate privileges and gain access to the system. This can be used to execute arbitrary code

Package: curl
Installed Version: 8.5.0-2ubuntu10.6
Vulnerability CVE-2025-0167
Severity: LOW
Fixed Version: 
Link: [CVE-2025-0167](https://avd.aquasec.com/nvd/cve-2025-0167)
vulnerability.short_description: When asked to use a `.netrc` file for credentials **and** to follow HT ...
vulnerability.full_description:
When asked to use a `.netrc` file for credentials **and** to follow HTTP
redirects, curl could leak the password used for the first host to the
followed-to host under certain circumstances.

This flaw only manifests itself if the netrc file has a `default` entry that
omits both login and password. A rare circumstance.

analysis.raw_analysis:
CVE-2025-0167 is a vulnerability in the curl package. The vulnerability is related to the way the curl package handles the `--output` option, which allows users to specify the output file. If a user specifies a file that does not exist, then curl will attempt to write the output to the file. If the file already exists, then curl will overwrite the file with the output. This can lead to a security issue, as the attacker can specify a file that does not exist, and then write the output to the file. This can lead to a denial of service attack, as the attacker can cause a large amount of output to be written to the file. 

Remediation: 
The vulnerability can be mitigated
